intro: Monotes gilletii, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Monotes gilletii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
